output.dependency: The type of health issue (i.e., type of heart condition or infection) denoted by one column (meaning descriptions of heart attack, heart failure, pneumonia, surgical infection prevention) determines the specific measure or treatment being referenced in the other column.
The unique identifier for measures or treatment protocols in one column directly relates to the detailed description of that measure or treatment in the other column.
The classification of the hospital type (i.e., voluntary non-profit) corresponds with the nature of services provided, indicated in the other column (acute care hospitals).
The postal code appears to be consistent across records for the same geographic area, while the name and location of the hospital serve as identifying factors for these postal codes.
The unique identifier patterns in one column suggest specific related health measures (i.e., the prefix relates to the type of treatments covered in the other column).
The prefix in the identifier relates to the type of medical condition or treatment described in the other column.
